etymologies: early 19th century: from oven and bird (with allusion to the domed or arched shape of many traditional forms of bread oven)

definitions: a small tropical American bird belonging to a diverse family, many members of which make domed nests of mud.

notes.text: Family Furnariidae (the ovenbird family): many genera and numerous species. The ovenbird family comprises the horneros, miners,and many others

definitions: a migratory brown North American warbler that builds a domed nest of vegetation on the ground.

notes.text: Seiurus aurocapillus, subfamily Parulinae, family Emberizidae

shortDefinitions: migratory brown North American warbler that builds domed oven-like nest of vegetation on ground
